blog_title: DeFi is… described by Bing
blog_content: DeFi stands for Decentralized Finance. It is a term used to describe an ecosystem of open-source technologies and financial products that operate outside of the traditional financial system without the need for intermediaries1. DeFi aims to create an open-source, permissionless, and transparent financial system that is accessible to everyone1. It allows people to lend, borrow, trade, and invest without intermediaries like banks or other financial institutions1. DeFi has been growing rapidly over the past few years and has become one of the most popular use cases for blockchain technology1.

Ay, but for me, mankind had never had
The art of fire, that great resource, but kept

blog_title: Working with Planar Graphs part2(Machine Learning)
blog_content: Partitioning edges of a planar graph into linear forests and a matching(arXiv) Author : Marthe Bonamy, Jadwiga Czyżewska, Łukasz Kowalik, Michał Pilipczuk Abstract : We show that the edges of any planar graph of maximum degree at most 9 can be partitioned into 4 linear forests and a matching. Combined with known results, this implies that the edges of any planar graph G of odd maximum degree Δ≥9 can be partitioned into Δ−12 linear forests and one matching. This strengthens well-known results stating that graphs in this class have chromatic index Δ [Vizing, 1965] and linear arboricity at most ⌈(Δ+1)/2⌉ [Wu, 1999].
